subject: Education
title: International Schools: Education for the Elite
description: A 60-second lesson on International Schools: Education for the Elite.

hook.text: There are now 13,000 international schools worldwide, serving mostly wealthy expat families. Tuition can exceed $50,000.

buildup.text: International schools began as places for diplomats' kids. Now they're a global industry worth $55 billion.

discovery.text: The IB diploma, born in Geneva in 1968, became the gold standard. It emphasizes critical thinking over rote

twist.text: Local families now fill most seats, pricing out the expats. In Asia, these schools are status symbols, not necessities.

climax.text: International schools show how education becomes a luxury good â€” excellent for those who can afford it.

punchline.text: The best education money can buy. That's the problem.

quiz.question: Approximately how many international schools exist worldwide?
